div1.p: William Smith vs Territory Washington } Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon E.P. Oliphant judge 1st judicial District Washington Territory

Your petitioner William Smith Complains that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by James Buckley Sheriff of said County on charge of Grand Larcery & petitions attys that said restraint is illegal in this that there is no evidence that said petitioner commited the act as alleged and that in point of fact is wholely untrue he therefore prays a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue and that you honor may inquire into the matter and that said your petitioner may be discharged prays from the illegal restraint
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of August 1862
William Smith vs Territory of Washington
Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Aug. 18th 1862 Writ allowed by E. P. Oliphant Judged
